NOTES: Basic verb “to do/make”; combines with the markers below (กำลังทำ, ทำอยู่, ทำแล้ว, จะทำ)
Marks ongoing action; usually before the verb (กำลังทำ = am doing)

DEFINITION: continuous marker at the end of a sentence
NOTES: At end of the clause to show ongoing action (ทำอยู่ = am doing it right now)
After the verb to show completion (ทำแล้ว = already did it)
With ไม่ for “not yet” (ยังไม่ทำ = haven’t done yet); alone can mean “still”
Before verb for past experience/habit (เคยทำ = have done before / used to do)
Before verb for “just did” (เพิ่งทำ = just did it recently)
Often with จะ for near future (เดี๋ยวจะทำ = I’ll do it in a moment)
กำลัง before a verb marks an action happening right now (present continuous)
ROOTS: กำลัง, กิน

THAI: ยังกินอยู่
NOTES: ยัง before the verb = “still”; shows action not finished
ROOTS: ยัง, กิน, อยู่

NOTES: แล้ว after the verb marks completion / “already”
จะ before a verb = “will / going to” (future or intention)
ROOTS: จะ, ไป, กิน
จะ, ไป, วิ่ง

NOTES: Base verb “run”; past/completed because of แล้ว
ROOTS: วิ่ง, แล้ว

NOTES: Verb “sit”; can also mean “sat down already”
ROOTS: นั่ง, แล้ว
